channel.title: Getting glow to work?

item.title: Getting glow to work?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

all i got is else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("modglow")) { glow = true; if (glow = true) {//code name Glow stillgfx(247, absY, absX); } } 

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("noglow"))
        {
               glow = false;
        }
public boolean glow = false;
[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 16, 2008, 06:11:53 PM[/size][hr]o and [code]
public boolean modglow = false;
public boolean noglow = false;
[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 16, 2008, 06:21:25 PM[/size][hr]whenever i add this under public boolean glow = false; [code]
      if (glow = true) {//code name Glow
                        stillgfx(247, absY, absX);
}

i get 100 errors
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 42, 2183, 66:210:252 PM[/size][hr]

item.title: Getting glow to work?
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

[quote=“Lusfr, post:3, topic:182015”]add this to boolean process

	if (glow = true) {//code name Glow
                    stillgfx(247, absY, absX);

}

and then your comand

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“Glow”))
{
glow = true;
}[/quote]
I bet he already has that.

               glow = true;
		if (glow = true) {//code name Glow
